result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed by RMW 11/3/22, c:DEF & SCSO, e:DA. cah
NONA 11/2/22 Return on WA, and to include unpaid October 1 & November 1, 2022, attorney fees totaling $100.00.  Defendant must both appear before the Court and pay $100.00 purge before release.

DE's Girlfriend called stating DE missed court today and went to turn himself in at the Dunn County jail and ended up having medical issue and taken to hospital. DE's Girlfriend states contacted Atty and advised Atty as well. arc

2:01 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Brian Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Timothy Sean Murphy. Defendant Timothy Sean Murphy not in court. Clerk called hall. Set for RW. Atty Selmer states he has had contact with the DE; they have an accepted offer. Atty Smestad responds, notes DE has not appeared at the last three hearings. Court lifts stay and issues warrant, body only, state-wide. If Atty Selmer has contact with DE, he may file a written request / statement and court will consider quashing warrant. Adjourned: 2:08 pm.

8:33 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Defendant Timothy Sean Murphy not in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer not in court.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk call hall. Court notes DE did not appear at last hearing and that warrant was stayed until today. Atty Selmer filed a continuance request for 10/27; JA advised hearing was 10/26 to which Atty Selmer responded he would be unavailable today and tomorrow. Atty Damrau asks that stay of warrant be lifted. Court extends the stay of warrant to 11/2 at 2:00 pm.
Return on warrant scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return on warrant on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Reschedule RW scheduled for 10/27/22, filed by Atty Selmer.  JA advised Atty Selmer- STC was held 10/26/22. RW scheduled for 11/2 at 2pm. bph
for continuance of 10/27/22. Filed by Atty Selmer. arc    to ty

8:49 AM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Timothy Sean Murphy.  Defendant Timothy Sean Murphy not in court.  Atty Selmer states a new offer was received yesterday, has not been able to reach DE to advise. States he is 99% that matter will settle. Atty Damrau makes comments, requests warrant, body only. Atty Selmer responds. Off record at 8:53 am for Atty Selmer to contact DE. Back on record at 8:57 am. Atty Selmer was unable to reach the DE. Court removes JT, court stays warrant until next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:17 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy Sean Murphy appeared by video.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Timothy Sean Murphy. The State sent an offer in June and will resend offer today. Court reschedules PSC to allow Atty Selmer to review. Atty Selmer states the def is reporting to JSC two  times per week for testing and has to take off work to get there and is difficult for the def to maintain. The State does not object to reduce to one time per week. Court does not amend bond today and resets BBH - in person. Remote options to be reviewed prior to BBH.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer   DF:  Timothy Sean Murphy appeared from jail. Case called at 10:34 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status to check on counsel. Atty Selmer has been appointed. Spoke with DE. DE states he does not have counsel appointed on sentencing after revocation. Contacted PD's office but was not told if qualifies or not. Court gives DE PFAC for 22CM291 file. PSC already scheduled. Court adjourned at 10:39 a.m.

FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $50/mo comm  8/1/2022. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. kma

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken     DF:  Timothy Sean Murphy appeared from jail, pro se. Case called at 9:03 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status to check on counsel. DE did not qualify for PD services. Did not file PFAC. DE requesting a postponement of case for 3 months. Court will not postpone file for that long. Can postpone payment. DE has application. Court schedules. DE is currently awaiting revocation. Court adjourned at 9:05 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Settlement conference on June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

01:30 PM  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. ADA:  Erica Ellenwood  DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius for today   DF:  Timothy Sean Murphy appeared from jail by video means. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does NOT qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument- DE is currently on a PO Hold. Court orders bond. Court sets PSC, SETC, and STC regarding status of atty. Court enters NG plea. gll  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
